Description: Terracotta artefact with two holes, perhaps the handle of a portable stove. Organic red-brown Nile silt with a black core and abundant mica, organic, quartz and white stone inclusions. Traces of black on the inside may have been caused by burning through use.
Curator's comments: Probably locally made Late Period coarseware for a stove.
Bibliographic references: Schlotzhauer & Villing 2006 / East Greek Pottery from Naukratis: The Current State of Research (no.108)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (LA.38) (Phase 3)
